title: How to Curl Hair with Braids

steps.title: Wash your hair.
steps.content: Wash your hair. Start by washing your hair as you usually would. Use shampoo and conditioner, especially if you have thick hair that tends to get dry. [1] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source

steps.title: Dry your hair so it is still slightly damp.
steps.content: Dry your hair so it is still slightly damp. Let your hair air dry or use a blow dryer. Make sure your hair feels damp but not soaking wet, as this will help your braided hair set and curl. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Braid your hair when it is about 80% dry. You can also dampen dry hair by spraying it with a spray bottle.

steps.title: Brush your hair.
steps.content: Brush your hair. Make sure there are no tangles in your hair. Use a brush or a comb to brush your hair when it is still slightly damp.

steps.title: Apply hair oil if you have thick or coarse hair.
steps.content: Apply hair oil if you have thick or coarse hair. If your hair tends to get frizzy when you braid it, you can apply nourishing hair oil to the ends of your hair before braid it. Take a dime-sized amount of hair oil in your hands and run them through the ends of your hair. Do not do this, however, if you have fine or straight hair, as it may prevent the curl from holding. [3] X Expert Source Ndeye Anta Niang Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 January 2020.

steps.title: Apply setting lotion or mousse if you have wavy or straight hair.
steps.content: Apply setting lotion or mousse if you have wavy or straight hair. Squeeze a small amount of lotion or mousse into your hand. Apply it evenly throughout your hair, starting at the middle of your hair and working down to the ends. [4] X Expert Source Ndeye Anta Niang Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 January 2020.

steps.title: Have 1-2 hair ties on hand.
steps.content: Have 1-2 hair ties on hand. You will need at least 1 hair tie to do a side braid. You will need 2 hair ties to create tight braids. Use hair ties that are wrapped in fabric or thread as they will not pull on your hair.

steps.title: Make a deep side part with your fingers.
steps.content: Make a deep side part with your fingers. Use your fingers to part all your hair, or as much of it as you can get, to one side. Move your fingers from the front of your hair to the back to gather up your hair to the side. [5] X Research source If you have bangs, you can let them fall as they are.

steps.title: Pull your hair to the side, over your shoulder.
steps.content: Pull your hair to the side, over your shoulder. Gently pull your hair over one of your shoulders so all your hair falls to one side of your face. Use your fingers, rather than a brush or comb, so your hair stays loose. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Separate your hair into 3 sections.
steps.content: Separate your hair into 3 sections. Take the left and right pieces of hair and loop them over each other.

steps.title: Loop the center piece through the left and right sections.
steps.content: Loop the center piece through the left and right sections. Take the center section and pull it up through the middle of the left and right pieces. Then, place it over either the right or left section.

steps.title: Braid
steps.content: Braid your hair all the way to ends. Continue braiding your hair, looping the sections over one another. Make sure you hold your hair firmly but not too tight as you braid so the side braid is loose.

steps.title: Secure the end of the braid with a hair tie.
steps.content: Secure the end of the braid with a hair tie. Once you have braided all your hair into a side braid, wrap a hair tie on the end to keep it in place. Use a scrunchy or ribbon if you have fine hair. Hair ties can leave dents in your hair that may interfere with your new wavy look.

steps.title: Leave the braid in overnight.
steps.content: Leave the braid in overnight. Sleep with your hair in the side braid. Try sleeping on the opposite side of the braid so it does not get too messed up during the night. [7] X Research source You can also wrap your hair in a scarf or wear a shower cap to bed to keep the braid in place.

steps.title: Remove the braid in the morning.
steps.content: Remove the braid in the morning. Once the braid has been in your hair overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours, take off the hair tie and carefully undo the braid. You should have loose waves on the ends of your hair, giving you a relaxed, curled hairstyle.

steps.title: Separate your hair into 2 sections down the middle.
steps.content: Separate your hair into 2 sections down the middle. Take your fingers and separate your hair, creating a center part. You should have 2 sections, one on either side of your face. [8] X Research source You can also use the pointed end of a comb to separate your hair into sections if thatâ€™s easier for you.

steps.title: Make 2 sections on one side of your head.
steps.content: Make 2 sections on one side of your head. Form 2 sections on 1 side of your hair, pulling from the top layer of your hair. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Twist together 2 pieces of hair.
steps.content: Twist together 2 pieces of hair. Hold 2 pieces of hair in either hand and twist them once in your hand. Then, loop them over each other in the opposite direction of the twist. Pull them tight to your head as you twist them. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Add more hair and twist the two pieces together.
steps.content: Add more hair and twist the two pieces together. Use one hand to keep the 2 pieces in place. Use the other hand to take 1 to 2 inches (2.5 to 5.1 cm) of hair into your hand and add it to one of the pieces. Then, loop the 2 pieces over each other. [11] X Research source Make sure you grab hair from the back of your head so you get all of your hair in the braid.

steps.title: Continue adding and twisting your hair until you reach the base of your neck.
steps.content: Continue adding and twisting your hair until you reach the base of your neck. Add more pieces of hair to the braid and twist each section over each other. Continue doing this until you have twisted your hair all the way down to your neck into a braid. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Twist the remaining hair into a tight bun.
steps.content: Twist the remaining hair into a tight bun . Once you reach the base of your neck, you may not have any more layers from the top of your hair that you can twist. Instead, you can curl the rest of your hair by tightly twisting it into a bun shape. [13] X Research source Make the bun very tight, as you do not want it to come undone during the night.

steps.title: Secure with a hair tie or scrunchy.
steps.content: Secure with a hair tie or scrunchy. Once you have twisted the rest of your hair into a tight bun, place a hair tie or scrunchy over the bun and secure it by wrapping the hair tie around it 1-2 times. Scrunchies are better for people with fine hair, as they prevent dents in your hair.

steps.title: Repeat the same steps with the other section of hair.
steps.content: Repeat the same steps with the other section of hair. Twist together the top layers of your hair, holding your hair tight as you loop and twist it. Do this until you reach the base of your neck. Then, twist the remaining hair into a tight bun. Secure the bun with a hair tie.

steps.title: Keep the braids in overnight.
steps.content: Keep the braids in overnight. Sleep with your hair in the tight braids so it can curl overnight. You may wear a scarf around your hair or a shower cap to keep your braids from falling out. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Take out the braids in the morning.
steps.content: Take out the braids in the morning. Carefully remove the hair ties. Then, gently unravel your braids. Do not tug on them too hard, as you do not want the curls to be pulled out. You can also try shaking out your hair to avoid ruining the braids. You should have tight curls all over your head. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Apply hair spray or curling cream to your hair.
steps.content: Apply hair spray or curling cream to your hair. Keep your curls in place by applying a few spritzes of hair spray or a small bit of curling cream to your curled hair. Use your hands to lightly scrunch your curls. You can also flip your hair over to add volume to your curls. [16] X Expert Source Ndeye Anta Niang Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 10 January 2020.

steps.title: Avoid brushing or touching your curled hair.
steps.content: Avoid brushing or touching your curled hair. Brushing your hair can ruin your curls. You should also try not to touch your hair too much throughout the day, as this can unravel your curls and make your hair appear oily or flat. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Wash your hair as you normally would to remove the curls.
steps.content: Wash your hair as you normally would to remove the curls. If you have dry hair, use a moisturizing shampoo to wash out your curls in the shower or bath. You can also use a conditioner if your hair tends to get dry or frizzy.
